description: France’s credit rating was downgraded Moody’s Ratings after far-right leader Marine Le Pen toppled the country’s government in a dispute over deficit reduction.
title: France Downgraded by Moody’s After Le Pen Derails Deficit Push

description: President-elect Donald Trump suggested that the US government has not been forthcoming about mysterious drone sightings that have alarmed residents of New Jersey and should offer more information about the incidents.
title: Trump Wants US to Provide Answers on Mystery New Jersey Drones

description: Germany’s opposition conservatives said they’ll maintain the country’s constitutional borrowing limits and oppose joint European Union debt issuance if they win next year’s federal election, according to a draft platform.
title: Germany’s ‘Debt Brake’ Backed by Conservatives in Election Plan

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Every Friday, White House correspondent Akayla Gardner delivers a roundup of the key news and events in politics, policy and economics that you need to know.  Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump’s Base Rises to Defense of Controversial Cabinet Picks

description: British Columbia’s governing New Democratic Party signed a four-year alliance with the tiny Green Party after barely scraping a victory in October’s provincial election.
title: British Columbia’s New Democrats Strike Governing Deal With Green Party

description: President-elect Donald Trump said Republicans will seek to eliminate Daylight Saving Time, calling the semiannual time changes “inconvenient” and “costly.”
title: Trump Vows to Eliminate ‘Inconvenient’ Daylight Saving Time

description: The US Supreme Court will take up a new test of religious rights, agreeing to consider a bid by a charitable arm of the Catholic Church for an exemption from Wisconsin’s unemployment tax.
title: Catholic Group Gets Supreme Court Hearing on Tax Exemption Bid

description: Texas has sued a New York doctor for prescribing abortion pills to a woman near Dallas, launching one of the first challenges in the U.S. to shield laws that Democrat-controlled states passed to protect physicians after Roe v. Wade was overturned.
title: Texas' Abortion Pill Lawsuit Against New York Doctor Marks New Challenge to Interstate Telemedicine

description: OpenAI’s top executive and AI search startup Perplexity are each donating $1 million to President-elect Donald Trump’s inaugural fund, a sign that artificial intelligence companies are trying to firm up relationships with the incoming administration.
title: OpenAI CEO, Perplexity Give $1 Million to Trump’s Inaugural Fund

description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken used an unannounced stop in Baghdad to ask Iraq’s prime minister to prevent Iran from shipping arms or other equipment through the country into Syria, a US official said Friday.
title: Blinken Asks Iraqi Leader to Prevent Iranian Arms Flow to Syria

description: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau’s government is set to end a rule that currently limits pension fund stakes to 30% of Canadian entities, as part of a plan to spur more domestic investment.
title: Canada to End 30% Stake Limit for Pension Fund Investments

description: President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva’s emergency surgery has suddenly forced Brazilians to confront a difficult question: Is their 79-year-old leader fit for the task of commanding Latin America’s largest economy?
title: Lula’s Age and Health Leave Brazil on Edge About What Comes Next

description: The European Union is proposing to sanction more than a dozen individuals and three entities as part of the bloc’s first set of measures hitting Russia for its disinformation operations and other hybrid activities.
title: EU Targets Russian Intelligence With First Disinformation Sanctions

description: Former House Speaker Nancy Pelosi was hospitalized after being injured during a congressional trip to Luxembourg, her office announced Friday in a statement.
title: Pelosi Hospitalized After Injury on Congressional Trip to Europe

description: Chicago city council’s budget votes that had been slated for Friday are expected to be delayed, according to Alderman Brian Hopkins.
title: Chicago Budget Vote Expected to Be Delayed Amid Tax-Hike Talks

description: Veteran centrist figure, Francois Bayrou, became France’s fourth prime minister in a year on Friday after President Emmanuel Macron named his longtime ally as the new head of government.
title: Macron Hands Poisoned Chalice to New Centrist French Premier

description: The three members of Chancellor Olaf Scholz’s now defunct coalition reached agreement on a package of tax relief and child benefits in a rare display of harmony before a confidence vote next week.
title: Scholz Gets Opposition Backing for Tax, Child-Benefit Package

description: Brazilian President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva left critical care and is now under semi-intensive care in a hospital in Sao Paulo, his doctors said Friday.
title: Brazilian Leader Lula Moves to Semi-Intensive Care After Brain Surgery

description: Donald Trump’s crypto project, World Liberty Financial, appears to be buying specialized digital tokens worth millions of dollars as speculation increases that the decentralized finance lending platform is moving closer to becoming operational.
title: Trump’s Crypto Project Is Buying Niche Tokens Worth Millions of Dollars

description: Isabel dos Santos, the self-exiled daughter of former Angolan President Jose Eduardo dos Santos, said she wants to return to her home country and may consider running for president if the opportunity arises.
title: Angola’s Isabel Dos Santos Signals She May Run for President

description: German Economy Minister Robert Habeck raised further doubts over the country’s plans for an early phase-out of coal-fired power generation.
title: Germany’s Habeck Casts Doubt on Plan for Early Coal Phase-Out

description: Any en-masse return of Syrian refugees to their native land would represent a conundrum for Turkey, too.
title: Syrian Refugees Are Conflicted About Returning Home

description: The UK, Japan and Italy formalized their planned venture to build a new generation fighter jet that the countries expect to deliver in a decade.
title: UK, Japan and Italy Set Up Joint Venture for Future Fighter Jet

description: The US and China renewed a longstanding agreement allowing limited government cooperation in science and technology, sustaining a lane of collaboration amid broader tensions over issues from national security to trade.
title: US, China Renew Science and Tech Cooperation Pact Amid Tensions

description: Turkey is asserting itself as the main player in the shaping of Syria’s future, sending a top official to Damascus and restarting diplomatic relations after more than a decade.
title: Turkey Is Emerging as Key Player in Forging Path of New Syria

description: The Energy Department’s lending program is a key part of Biden’s climate legacy, but its future is uncertain after January.
title: With Trump Looming, Biden’s Green Bank Moves to Close Billions in Deals

description: America’s top diplomat in China said he spends 80% of his time managing competition with Beijing and 20% on engagement, calling it the right balance as Washington prepares for a new administration.
title: Outgoing US Envoy to China Says Ties on ‘Right Road,’ Don’t Veer

description: As Donald Trump stacks his cabinet with loyalists, he appears to be angling to put another devoted ally on Capitol Hill: His daughter-in-law, Lara Trump.
title: Lara Trump’s Political Prize Beckons With Florida Senate Vacancy

description: Finland will review whether to reintroduce antipersonnel land mines for improved defenses against Russia on the NATO defense bloc’s longest land border with its main adversary.
title: Finland to Study Bringing Back Land Mines to Improve Defenses

description: President Emmanuel Macron picked Francois Bayrou to be France’s new prime minister, calling on a longstanding centrist ally to navigate a fractured political landscape that toppled the previous administration.
title: Macron Names Centrist Bayrou to Be New French Prime Minister

description: The number of unauthorized arrivals by migrants and asylum seekers into the European Union fell 40% in the first 11 months of 2024 compared to the same period in 2023, just as fresh turmoil in Syria has sparked concerns about renewed flows.
title: Unauthorized Migration to EU Drops as Bloc Watches Syria Events

description: Finland is considering whether it can confiscate real estate holdings on the grounds that they may pose a threat to its national security after years of Russians buying assets, including near critical infrastructure.
title: Finland Considers Allowing Property Seizures to Boost Security

description: Eric Trump has big plans for his family’s real estate firm as his father prepares to enter the White House for a second term: New projects in Europe, Vietnam and India; perhaps a Trump-branded golf course in Saudi Arabia; “certainly” buildings in Israel at some point down the line.
title: Eric Trump Says He’s ‘Wrong Guy’ to Gain US Favor Amid Deal Push

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: A Dictator’s Fall Is Roiling European Politics

description: Germany’s economy will hardly grow in 2025 after shrinking again this year, according to fresh forecasts from Bundesbank.
title: German Economy Will Hardly Grow in 2025, Bundesbank Says

description: President-elect Donald Trump says renewing tax cuts would turbo-charge investment and boost US economic growth — a pledge that helped propel him to election victory in November.
title: Trump’s Tax Cuts May Fail to Drive Much, If Any, Economic Boost

description: Ukraine said Russia launched a massive air-strike on Friday, targeting the western part of the country with missiles after weeks of relative lull in aerial attacks.
title: Russia Attacks Western Ukraine in First Missile Strike in Weeks

description: By assassinating an interim minister in Afghanistan’s de facto government on Dec. 11, a branch of the radical group Islamic State escalated its conflict with its fellow Islamist movement, the Taliban, which retook power in the country three years ago. Killed in a suicide bombing at his office in Kabul, Khalil Ur-Rahman Haqqani, the Taliban’s minister for refugees and repatriation, is the highest-profile target so far of the Islamic State Khorasan, or ISIS-K.
title: What Is ISIS-K and Why Is It Fighting the Taliban in Afghanistan

description: India’s $6 billion plan to build submarines has stalled because of contractor complaints over whether proper procedures were followed during tests at sea, delaying the navy’s efforts to bolster its capabilities as China expands its presence in the Indian Ocean.
title: Modi’s $6 Billion Submarine Building Plan Stalls After Sea Tests

description: The US will send a warship to visit a naval base in Cambodia for the first time since the Southeast Asian nation reportedly signed a deal in 2019 that would allow China to establish a permanent foothold there.
title: US Warship Makes Rare Visit to Cambodia Base at Center of Feud

description: A diplomatic row may further delay the construction of a multi-billion dollar project in Lesotho that’s needed to ward off a water crisis in South Africa, Business Day reported, citing court papers and other documents.
title: South Africa, Lesotho Row Puts Water Project at Risk, BD Says

description: Taiwan’s legislators are set to review a proposed legal change that would make it more difficult for the president to declare martial law, with lawmakers from the opposition Kuomintang advocating the amendment after the shock emergency declaration in South Korea earlier this month.
title: Taiwan Reviews Legal Change Making Martial Law Harder to Declare

description: As South Korea waits for another opposition push to impeach President Yoon Suk Yeol on Saturday, more details are emerging of what happened in the hours surrounding his declaration of martial law.
title: Five Minutes to Martial Law: Yoon Stunned Cabinet With Snap Move

description: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol’s approval rating slid to its lowest level since he took office as he tried to defend his declaration of martial law and push back against efforts to oust him via impeachment.
title: South Korea Support for Yoon Hits Record Low Before Key Impeachment Vote

description: Australia’s main opposition group laid out a A$331 billion ($211 billion) plan to create a taxpayer-funded nuclear power industry in just over a decade, despite the nation’s top scientists saying renewable energy such as wind and solar energy is more cost effective.
title: Australia’s Opposition Reveals $211 Billion Nuclear Power Plan

description: Confidence among Japan’s large firms remained upbeat, broadly in line with the Bank of Japan’s view ahead of a policy meeting next week that’s dividing analyst opinions over whether a rate hike is coming.
title: Japan’s Business Sentiment Stays Upbeat in Line With BOJ View

description: The UK plans to reform rules on planning and connecting to its power grid in hopes of spurring some £40 billion of investment a year through 2030 to try and eliminate fossil fuels from electricity generation.
title: UK Aims to Unlock £240 Billion Green Power Blitz to Cut Gas
